title: President Trump indicted in hush money case
description: Former President Trump has been indicted on criminal charges by a New York grand jury. This makes him the first former president in American history to face indictment.

title: Trump indictment is just one of the legal threats he faces post-presidency
description: NPR's Adrian Florido talks to Kim Wehle, former U.S. attorney and now professor at the University of Baltimore, about the political and legal implications of an indictment of former President Trump.

title: Former President Donald Trump has been indicted by a Manhattan grand jury
description: The criminal indictment has been a topic of long-term anticipation, sharpened by recent news that Trump was invited to testify before the grand jury.

title: Live updates: Donald Trump will be indicted for his role in hush money payments
description: The former president and 2024 hopeful has been indicted by a grand jury, multiple sources close to Trump confirmed to NPR. Join NPR as we unpack key moments.

title: Idaho lawmakers pass a bill to prevent minors from leaving the state for abortion
description: The first of its kind in the country, the Idaho legislature has passed a bill allowing criminal charges for those who help a minor get an abortion out of state. The bill now goes to Gov. Brad Little.

title: Turkey's parliament clears the way for Finland to join NATO
description: All 276 lawmakers present voted in favor of Finland's application. The action lifted the last hurdle in the way of the Nordic country's long-delayed accession into the Western military alliance.

title: Al Sharpton to focus on police mental health response after Irvo Otieno's death
description: Irvo Otieno was killed in custody earlier this month at a psychiatric hospital while experiencing mental health distress. Reverend Al Sharpton says this has to be a turning point.

title: As debt ceiling talks stall, Speaker McCarthy says GOP may move its own bill
description: President Biden and Speaker McCarthy continue to spar over the next steps in negotiations on the debt ceiling. The country  faces a historic default if no deal is reached before the summer deadline.

title: A deadly fire spotlights problematic migrant detention in Mexico
description: The deaths of at least 39 migrants in a temporary detention center in Ciudad Juarez raises broader questions about migrant detention in Mexico. NPR's Adrian Florido talks with reporter James Fredrick.

title: A train carrying ethanol and corn syrup derailed in Minnesota
description: A BNSF train hauling ethanol and corn syrup derailed and caught fire in Minnesota about 100 miles west of Minneapolis. Residents were ordered to evacuate. No injuries were reported.

title: California continues to get walloped by storms. When might it end?
description: Another major storm has many Californians asking when will this stop? Dozens of towns and communities are still dealing with flooding from earlier storms.

title: Doctors Without Borders in Ukraine reports on what Russia left in its wake
description: NPR's Adrian Florido talks to Christopher Stokes, who leads the Doctors Without Borders operation in Ukraine. A recent report by the organization says the medical situation in frontline areas is dire.

title: MLB's Opening Day brings rule changes meant to enliven the game
description: It's Opening Day for Major League Baseball. The league is hoping that some new rules this season will mean big changes for players — and for fans.

title: Russia detains a 'Wall Street Journal' reporter on claims of spying
description: Russia detained a U.S. journalist working for The Wall Street Journal, accusing him of espionage. Evan Gershkovich was reporting in the city of Yekaterinburg when he was detained.

title: States are looking for ways to make free school meals permanent
description: During the COVID-19 pandemic, states could offer free meals to every public school student every school day. That program ended, but some states, like Vermont, are looking to keep it on their own.

title: The fight over Kentucky's transgender care ban was long and emotional
description: State Sen. Karen Berg lost her trans son to suicide before the Kentucky legislative session began and pleaded with Republicans not to pass restrictive LGBTQ laws. This week, Republicans did just that.

title: Biden asks banking regulators to toughen some rules after recent bank failures
description: President Biden on Thursday urged banking regulators to take additional steps to reduce the risk of more mid-sized bank failures like Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank.

title: Judge's ruling undercuts U.S. health law's preventive care
description: A federal judge in Texas who previously ruled to dismantle the Affordable Care Act struck down a key part of the law. Opponents say the ruling jeopardizes preventive care for millions of Americans.

title: The Ciudad Juárez detention fire shows inhumane conditions for migrants, advocates say
description: Migrants say they are facing increased harassment and unabashed cruelty by local, state and federal authorities as permanent residents' general attitudes toward immigrants shift.

title: The Vatican repudiates 'Doctrine of Discovery,' which was used to justify colonialism
description: The doctrine, with origins in the 15th century, was invoked as a legal and religious standing by Europeans who "discovered" new lands and violently seized it from people who had been living there.

title: Disney blocked DeSantis's oversight board. What happens next?
description: The board members picked by Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis to oversee development around Walt Disney World announced on Tuesday that they didn't quite have the power they thought they had.

title: Prosecutors say Pras Michel broke the law 'to get paid'
description: Prosecutors said musician Pras Michel collected exorbitant sums of money from a billioniare desperate to win access to two separate U.S. presidents.

title: Former President Bolsonaro returns to Brazil after three months in Florida
description: The far-right leader went to Florida after losing his bid for re-election, days before his rival was inaugurated. While in Florida, Bolsonaro frequently met with supporters and conservative groups.

title: A train carrying ethanol derails and catches fire in Minnesota, forcing evacuations
description: About 22 cars carrying ethanol and corn syrup derailed west of Minneapolis; four are on fire. The derailment's cause is under investigation. There is a half-mile evacuation area around the crash site.

title: Mexico investigates 8 workers and officials over the fatal fire at a migrant facility
description: Authorities said Wednesday that they're looking into the actions of eight people for possible misconduct at the detention center, where a fire killed 39 men.

title: Russia detains 'Wall Street Journal' reporter, accuse him of espionage
description: Evan Gerskovich, a U.S. citizen, was on a reporting assignment in the Ural mountain city of Yekaterinburg when he was detained by agents from Russia's Federal Security Services

title: Taiwan's president arrives in the U.S. amid warnings from China
description: Taiwan's president is in the United States as part of a multi-day itinerary that will take the leader of the Asian democratic island through Central and North America.

title: All new cars in the EU will be zero-emission by 2035. Here's where the U.S. stands
description: European Union states agreed to a plan after adding an exemption for cars that run on e-fuels. In the U.S., efforts to phase out gas-powered cars include future bans in several states.

title: A therapist has advice for how to cope with repeated mass shootings: Lean into family
description: The U.S. sees hundreds of mass shootings each year —  so many that some people have survived more than one. A therapist offers advice for how to cope with the trauma.

title: How to cope with the trauma of mass shootings
description: The news of hundreds of mass shootings each year can affect a person's sense of safety. NPR's A Martinez speaks with therapist Michael Davidovitz about how to cope with the trauma of mass shootings.

title: 4 storylines to watch for Major League Baseball's opening day
description: How many home runs will Aaron Judge hit? Will the San Diego Padres finally get their first World Series title? And how will a suite of rule changes affect the game?

title: Sacramento will rename a skate park after its former resident Tyre Nichols
description: The late 29-year-old Sacramento native will be posthumously honored with a bronze plaque that will be installed at the newly renamed park.

title: A rehab center revives traumatized Ukrainian troops before their return to battle
description: Built largely with Western donations, the spa-like retreat provides soldiers with counseling, aromatherapy and more. But most soldiers are there for no more than a week.

title: As states start to get opioid settlement cash, few are sharing how they spend it
description: All told, drugmakers and distributors will pay over $50 billion to communities harmed by opioids. An investigation finds that only a dozen states are letting the public see how they use the money.

title: These are the states with the highest and lowest tax burdens, a report says
description: A new report by WalletHub measured how much people pay in property, income and sales tax in proportion to the amount of money they make.

title: 2 U.S. military helicopters crash during training in Kentucky
description: Two military helicopters crashed Wednesday night in southwestern Kentucky during a training mission, the U.S. Army said in a statement. The status of the crew members wasn't immediately known.

title: A ferry fire in the Philippines leaves more than 30 dead, a governor says
description: A ferry carrying about 250 passengers and crew caught fire in the southern Philippines and 31 people drowned or died in the blaze and were discovered later, a provincial governor said Thursday.

title: Melissa Joan Hart says she helped kindergarteners escape the Nashville shooting
description: Hart, known for her starring role on Sabrina the Teenage Witch, said her children attend school near Nashville's Covenant School.
